text: Asif Aslam Farrukhi (), was a Pakistani writer and editor. He was a physician by training. He translated books from English into Urdu. He edited anthologies of Pakistani writers. He also wrote for Dawn and other newspapers, and periodicals on literature. He received the Tamgha-e-Imtiaz, the fourth highest civilian honour of Pakistan. Farrukhi was born on 16 September 1959. He died on 1 June 2020 in Karachi, aged 60.Dawn June 1, 2020 ==References== Category:1959 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Editors Category:Translators Category:Pakistani writers
title: Asif Farrukhi
